hypothesis_content.title: Positive Catalyst Fade in Stress Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes (high volatility, deleveraging), positive catalysts (regulatory approval, institutional adoption news) will generate brief 2-4% rallies that fully reverse within 6 hours as sellers use liquidity to exit.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stress regimes are characterized by forced selling and risk reduction. Any rally provides exit liquidity for distressed positions, creating predictable fade patterns.
entry_conditions: Market in STRESS regime (VIX > 25, crypto vol > 120%)
Positive crypto-specific catalyst (ETF approval, major partnership)
BTC spikes 2-4% within 30 minutes on high volume (>1.5x 20-day avg)
Open interest decreases during rally (indicating short covering, not new longs)
Funding rates remain negative or near zero

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to pre-catalyst level (full fade)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC sustains >80% of rally for 4+ hours with increasing OI

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: >40% of stress regime positive catalysts lead to sustained rallies (>80% retained after 6 hours) with increasing open interest.
